name: Technical Assistance to Cooperatives
objective: To develop and administer research, technical assistance, statistical, and educational programs on financial, organizational, management, legal, social, and economic aspects of rural cooperatives, and to work with cooperatives and educational organizations in promoting the knowledge of cooperative principles and practices.
assistance_types: U.S. Territories and possessions (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
beneficiary_types: Physically Afflicted (e.g. TB, Arthritis, Heart Disease)
Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)

results.description: Accomplishments may include cooperative education and technical assistance to the public; statistical benchmarks and analysis about cooperative businesses; support and promotion of cooperative business development; implementation and continuance of the Secretary of Agriculture’s mandate under 7 U.S.C. 1932(e)(12) to chair an Interagency Working Group on Cooperative Development.
